title: Map gallery
text: Export many maps (use whatever loop/apply/parallel approach prefer) Copy Quarto index template out_path render out_path/index.qmd get out_path/index.html
code: require(clusterTrack ) require(clusterTrack.Vis)  out_path = "path/to/empty/dir" map(x1, path = out_path) map(x2, path = out_path) ... map(xn, path = out_path) site(out_path)

title: Authors and Citation

title: Authors and Citation

code: @Manual{,   title = {clusterTrack: Clustering Animal Movements},   author = {Mihai Valcu},   year = {2026},   note = {R package version 0.1.0.1},   url = {https://ornitho-logics.github.io/clusterTrack/}, }

title: Clustering Animal Movements
text: Identification use-sites animal movement tracks using spatiotemporal segmentation adjacency-based spatial clustering clusterTrack provides clustering-based framework identifying recurring use-sites animal movement tracks complex spatiotemporal structure. designed data irregular sampling, noise, long temporal gaps, fragmented revisitation patterns, movement models purely spatial clustering often perform poorly.

what: Aggregate (merge) adjacent clusters by spatial proximity — aggregate_ctdf
title: Aggregate (merge) adjacent clusters by spatial proximity — aggregate_ctdf
text: Iteratively merges temporally adjacent cluster ids whose locations within dist . repair/aggregation step existing clustering: compute clusters scratch, merges neighbouring ones.

title: Aggregate (merge) adjacent clusters by spatial proximity — aggregate_ctdf
Aggregate (merge) adjacent clusters by spatial proximity — aggregate_ctdf
text: ctdf ctdf object. Must contain cluster, timestamp, location. dist Aggregation scale km.

title: Aggregate (merge) adjacent clusters by spatial proximity — aggregate_ctdf
text: input ctdf, invisibly, cluster updated -place.

title: Aggregate (merge) adjacent clusters by spatial proximity — aggregate_ctdf
text: Merging put graph problem. undirected adjacency graph constructed one vertex per cluster. edge added two vertices corresponding consecutive cluster ids (cluster cluster + 1) distance geometries less dist. clusters merged taking connected components graph. procedure repeated merges occur. Representative geometry cluster computed centroid convex hull points cluster. updates cluster reference.

what: Cluster a movement track into spatiotemporal clusters — cluster_track
title: Cluster a movement track into spatiotemporal clusters — cluster_track
text: cluster_track assigns cluster id location ctdf running multi-step pipeline: identify temporally continuous putative regions via slice_ctdf(). merge temporally adjacent putative regions  via spatial_repair(). locally cluster putative region using DTSCAN via  sf_dtscan(). enforce non-overlap time merging clusters overlapping time domains via temporal_repair(). drop small clusters run additional spatial repairs via spatial_repair() tail_repair(). optionally merge adjacent clusters within aggregate_dist via aggregate_ctdf().

title: Cluster a movement track into spatiotemporal clusters — cluster_track
code: cluster_track(   ctdf,   nmin = 3,   z_min = 1,   trim = 0.05,   minCluster = 3,   deltaT,   aggregate_dist )

title: Cluster a movement track into spatiotemporal clusters — cluster_track
text: ctdf ctdf object (see as_ctdf()). nmin Integer; passed local_cluster_ctdf() (nmin). (clusters N <= minCluster dropped final repairs). z_min Numeric; pruning strictness SD units. Smaller values produce compact clusters often unassigned points. Implementation detail: underlying thresholds use inverse z-score convention, sign flipped internally; see sf_dtscan()  local_cluster_ctdf(). trim Numeric; passed temporal_repair(). Maximum fraction trimmed minCluster Integer; minimum number points required keep putative cluster used splitting candidate regions movement segments. tail estimating cluster's time domain. deltaT Optional numeric; passed slice_ctdf(). Maximum allowable time gap (days) aggregate_dist Optional numeric; supplied, passed aggregate_ctdf() dist (numeric treated km).

title: Cluster a movement track into spatiotemporal clusters — cluster_track
text: Invisibly returns ctdf, cluster updated -place attr(ctdf, "cluster_params") set.

title: Cluster a movement track into spatiotemporal clusters — cluster_track
text: function updates ctdf reference stores parameters attr(ctdf, "cluster_params").

title: Cluster a movement track into spatiotemporal clusters — cluster_track
code: data(mini_ruff) x = as_ctdf(mini_ruff) |> cluster_track() #> → Find putative cluster regions. #> ! Spatial repair. #> → Local clustering. #> ! Temporal repair.  if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ data(pesa56511) pesa = as_ctdf(pesa56511, time = "locationDate") |> cluster_track()  data(ruff143789) ruff = as_ctdf(ruff143789, time = "locationDate") |> cluster_track()  data(ruff07b5) ruff2 = as_ctdf(ruff07b5, time = "timestamp") |> cluster_track()  data(lbdo66862) lbdo2 = as_ctdf(lbdo66862, time = "locationDate") |> cluster_track()  data(nola125a) nola = as_ctdf(nola125a, time = "timestamp") |> cluster_track()   } # }

what: DTSCAN: Delaunay Triangulation-Based Spatial Clustering. — sf_dtscan
title: DTSCAN: Delaunay Triangulation-Based Spatial Clustering. — sf_dtscan
text: Runs clustering using Delaunay triangulation point coordinates.

title: DTSCAN: Delaunay Triangulation-Based Spatial Clustering. — sf_dtscan
code: sf_dtscan(x, min_pts = 5, area_z_min = -1, length_z_min = -1, id_col = NULL)

title: DTSCAN: Delaunay Triangulation-Based Spatial Clustering. — sf_dtscan
text: x sf object POINT geometry. min_pts Minimum neighbour count point treated core point. Neighbours sites directly connected kept Delaunay edges pruning. multiple input points share exactly coordinates, collapsed one site multiplicity contributes count. area_z_min Threshold (SD units) inverse z-score triangle areas used pruning. Larger thresholds keep progressively smaller--average triangles prune edges. Default 0. length_z_min Threshold (SD units) inverse z-score Delaunay edge lengths used pruning. Larger thresholds keep progressively shorter--average edges prune connections. id_col Optional character scalar naming unique identifier column x used align output. NULL missing x, output aligned current row order.

title: DTSCAN: Delaunay Triangulation-Based Spatial Clustering. — sf_dtscan
text: integer vector cluster labels length nrow(x). 0 indicates noise/unassigned; positive integers cluster ids.

title: DTSCAN: Delaunay Triangulation-Based Spatial Clustering. — sf_dtscan
text: Identical coordinates collapsed triangulation; multiplicity contributes MinPts via effective_degree = degree + (mult - 1). Cluster labels produced starting new cluster unassigned core site (site meeting MinPts rule) iteratively visiting sites reachable pruned Delaunay edges seed; cluster id assigned every visited site.

title: DTSCAN: Delaunay Triangulation-Based Spatial Clustering. — sf_dtscan
text: Kim, J., & Cho, J. (2019). Delaunay triangulation-based spatial clustering technique enhanced adjacent boundary detection segmentation LiDAR 3D point clouds. Sensors, 19(18), 3926. doi:10.3390/s19183926

title: DTSCAN: Delaunay Triangulation-Based Spatial Clustering. — sf_dtscan
code: data("moons", package = "dbscan") m = sf::st_as_sf(moons, coords = c("X", "Y")) m$cluster = sf_dtscan(m) dbscan::hullplot(moons, m$cluster)

what: Slice a CTDF into putative clusters using temporal continuity and spatial clustering — slice_ctdf
title: Slice a CTDF into putative clusters using temporal continuity and spatial clustering — slice_ctdf
text: Identifies spatially heterogeneous regions (via HDBSCAN point coordinates) , regions, recursively subdivides track temporally continuous movement segments. Subdivision continues region spatially homogeneous (evidence multiple clusters) .

title: Slice a CTDF into putative clusters using temporal continuity and spatial clustering — slice_ctdf
Slice a CTDF into putative clusters using temporal continuity and spatial clustering — slice_ctdf
text: ctdf CTDF object. nmin Integer;  smallest size putative cluster. deltaT Numeric; maximum allowable time gap (days) segment endpoints intersections  consider continuous.

title: Slice a CTDF into putative clusters using temporal continuity and spatial clustering — slice_ctdf
text: Invisibly returns ctdf, .putative_cluster updated -place.

title: Slice a CTDF into putative clusters using temporal continuity and spatial clustering — slice_ctdf
text: function updates ctdf -place. Internally, candidate regions queued. Regions show evidence multiple clusters split movement segmentation; otherwise retained single putative cluster.

title: Slice a CTDF into putative clusters using temporal continuity and spatial clustering — slice_ctdf
code: data(mini_ruff) ctdf = as_ctdf(mini_ruff, s_srs = 4326, t_srs = "+proj=eqearth") ctdf = slice_ctdf(ctdf)  data(pesa56511) ctdf = as_ctdf(pesa56511, time = "locationDate", s_srs = 4326, t_srs = "+proj=eqearth") ctdf = slice_ctdf(ctdf) #>   ⠙ 32 segments processed [2s]  #>   ⠹ 34 segments processed [2.1s]  #>   ⠸ 40 segments processed [2.3s]  #>   ⠼ 46 segments processed [2.5s]  #>

what: Repair spatially overlapping adjacent putative clusters — spatial_repair
title: Repair spatially overlapping adjacent putative clusters — spatial_repair
text: Iteratively merges temporally adjacent putative clusters whose convex hulls intersect. operates .putative_cluster column created slice_ctdf() updates -place.

title: Repair spatially overlapping adjacent putative clusters — spatial_repair
Repair spatially overlapping adjacent putative clusters — spatial_repair
text: ctdf ctdf object. Must contain .putative_cluster (typically produced slice_ctdf()). time_contiguity Logical; TRUE, enforce temporal contiguity within clusters filling internal gaps described . Default TRUE.

title: Repair spatially overlapping adjacent putative clusters — spatial_repair
text: input ctdf, invisibly, .putative_cluster updated -place.

title: Repair spatially overlapping adjacent putative clusters — spatial_repair
text: time_contiguity = TRUE, missing .putative_cluster values identical forward- backward-filled labels filled, cluster becomes temporally contiguous (short spatial outliers inside cluster absorbed).

what: Repair putative clusters by trimming track tails — tail_repair
title: Repair putative clusters by trimming track tails — tail_repair
text: Removes leading trailing "tail" portions .putative_cluster based self-crossings within-cluster track. intent keep locally revisited core cluster drop commuting legs beginning end.

title: Repair putative clusters by trimming track tails — tail_repair
Repair putative clusters by trimming track tails — tail_repair
text: ctdf ctdf object.

title: Repair putative clusters by trimming track tails — tail_repair

title: Repair putative clusters by trimming track tails — tail_repair

title: tdbscan — tdbscan
text: tdbscan

title: tdbscan — tdbscan
code: tdbscan(track, eps, minPts = 5, borderPoints = FALSE, maxLag = 6, minTenure)

title: tdbscan — tdbscan
text: track sf object (now). eps size epsilon neighborhood (see dbscan::dbscan()  ). minPts number minimum points eps region (core points). Default 5 points (see dbscan::dbscan()  ). borderPoints Logical; default FALSE (see dbscan::dbscan()  ). maxLag maximum relative temporal lag (see notes). Default 6. minTenure minimum time difference, hours, last first entry cluster. Clusters  values smaller minTenure discarded.

title: tdbscan — tdbscan
text: maxLag set maxLag>N output dbscan.

title: tdbscan — tdbscan
code: data(pesa56511) x = as_tdbscan(pesa56511, time = "locationDate") x = sf::st_transform(x, "+proj=eqearth") z = tdbscan(track = x, eps = 6600, minPts = 8, maxLag = 6) table(z$clustID) #>  #>   1   2   3   4   5   6  #>  67  60  17  33 128 454

what: Repair temporally overlapping putative clusters — temporal_repair
title: Repair temporally overlapping putative clusters — temporal_repair
text: Merges .putative_cluster labels whose (trimmed) time domains overlap. putative cluster, time interval [lo, hi] estimated timestamp distribution trimming small fraction tail reduce sensitivity single-point temporal outliers. clusters overlapping intervals merged (transitively) using connected components overlap graph.

title: Repair temporally overlapping putative clusters — temporal_repair
Repair temporally overlapping putative clusters — temporal_repair
text: ctdf ctdf object. Must contain timestamp .putative_cluster. trim Numeric [0, 0.5). Maximum fraction trimmed tail estimating cluster's time domain. effective trim per cluster min(trim, 1 / n_i) n_i number points cluster.

title: Repair temporally overlapping putative clusters — temporal_repair
text: input ctdf, invisibly, .putative_cluster updated -place.

title: Repair temporally overlapping putative clusters — temporal_repair
text: Clusters merged using connected components interval overlap graph: undirected graph one vertex per .putative_cluster, edge two vertices  trimmed time intervals overlap.
